tweet: It also provides relief to our families and businesses still hurting and addressing the damage caused by COVID-19, corrects the underfunding of our unemployment system and invests in our future. We have an opportunity to provide real relief and jump ahead of other states.

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: I pledge I am going to do everything in my power to make sure Kentucky leads in the post-COVID economy, and I also pledge to lead in ways that show love, compassion and understanding. #SOTC2021

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: When we talk about COVID being a fast moving train, it doesn’t just immediately turn; you have to slow it down, stop it and turn it around. We still believe that’s what we’re seeing.

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Our future is going to be entirely different post-COVID, with more opportunity for Kentuckians. This administration is committed to ensuring our state doesn't stumble out of this pandemic, but we soar. #BetterKy

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Gov. Andy Beshear asked all Kentuckians to redouble efforts to fight COVID-19 as Kentucky surpassed 200,000 cases of coronavirus in the commonwealth, with 2,567 new cases reported on Sunday. Read more:  https://t.co/yezWxMWJpm     https://t.co/8Jeppl4c3p

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Gov. Andy Beshear announced today that Kentucky has had its new highest week of COVID-19 cases, and two reported dead from the virus Saturday were in their 30s and 40s. Read more:  https://t.co/0o4lg5UOmx  https://t.co/lweSU1YNTW

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Kentucky is expected to receive 38,025 COVID-19 vaccine doses in the first round of shipments from the federal government. These doses are all for the initial vaccine; booster shots will be delivered approximately three weeks later.  https://t.co/fAOJQ0tjIg

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: The initial allocation sites were chosen because they were large enough to handle 975 Pfizer doses; the CDC required they had to have ultra-low cold storage; they had to be completely enrolled as a COVID provider; and we wanted a good coverage area across Kentucky.

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Today, Gov. Andy Beshear announced that Kentucky has surpassed 2,000 COVID-19 deaths and the positivity rate is now higher than 10%.  https://t.co/HZ0h55VGUm  https://t.co/iWTOciQUnG

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: COVID-19 has emphasized the critical need of quality health coverage for our people. Please, take advantage of open enrollment through @kynect_ky now through Dec. 15.  https://t.co/ueEZwDjmAj #GetCovered2021  https://t.co/fMlI4OY0Va

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Yesterday was a hard day as we set a number of COVID reporting records including,   ➡️new cases ➡️ new deaths  ➡️ new cases among children 18 and younger  ➡️ hospitalizations  ➡️ ICU ➡️ ventilator   It's time to act, Kentucky. Mask up and follow the guidance to slow this surge.  https://t.co/l6OjadP9Bp

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: On Sunday, Gov. Andy Beshear thanked every Kentuckian who sacrificed for each other and rose to the challenge of battling COVID-19 together during the Thanksgiving holiday.  https://t.co/ZmvMV8gz7x  https://t.co/hSwmSCq3Rw

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: On Saturday, Gov. Andy Beshear urged Kentuckians to strengthen their resolve in the fight against COVID-19, with the knowledge that help is on the way.  https://t.co/g5n2t6wiRt  https://t.co/XB8m3yiVCS

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: We are building a better Kentucky thanks to innovative companies like @AppHarvest. We are working hard to ensure we don't stumble out of COVID, we sprint. #TogetherKy

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Today, Gov. Andy Beshear reported 3,408 new COVID-19 cases and again asked all Kentuckians to follow safety precautions during Thanksgiving as cases surge in the commonwealth and across the country.  https://t.co/r5hFnhiTmn  https://t.co/UwnyenxKJo

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Thanksgiving week could cause a dangerous COVID-19 surge, but Kentuckians can prevent that. Read more:  https://t.co/jUytD4HJN8  https://t.co/0HsldFFFj9

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: ➡️In less than 10 months, Covid-19 deaths have reached more than five times the average number of annual flu deaths. ➡️Deaths from COVID are five times higher than deaths by suicide each year.    https://t.co/gGKwq53HXA

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: "It shows you how easy it is to get Covid-19 in the Midwest. Our staff are being infected mostly due to community spread, and this impacts our ability to care for patients.” Dr. Amy Williams, dean of clinical practice, Mayo clinic.    https://t.co/llhD9e9K2F

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Yesterday Dr. @StevenStackMD, commissioner of the Kentucky Department for Public Health, shared new models demonstrating how COVID cases, hospitalizations and deaths will likely progress in the state if Kentuckians don’t take action to flatten the curve.   https://t.co/AsAVrStXZM

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Almost all of Kentucky is now red. We look at other areas like El Paso where they have mobile morgues, or Idaho where one of every three people in the primary care clinics have COVID, and we see where this virus could go.    https://t.co/CEia65eDRM

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Today, Gov. Andy Beshear reported the state’s highest number of COVID-19 cases yet again with 3,303 new cases. Read more:  https://t.co/Woq8ivSURN    https://t.co/X2pGfz1sxE

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Rural areas, very much like our own, are seeing the impacts of COVID on their hospitals, health care workers and people. The only way to prevent this from happening here is to mask up, stay home when possible and follow the guidance. #MaskUpKy    https://t.co/CLBilk8vZ7

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: We’ve seen over the past couple weeks that COVID-19 is spreading at an alarming rate, and this lawsuit could have eliminated every single safeguard we have here in Kentucky to keep you safe.  https://t.co/ftzGNmpAsy

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: During COVID-19 when many Kentuckians are seeking new opportunities this scholarship can help students get free or reduced tuition to take industry-specific, short-term courses that prepare them to get to work in weeks, or they can choose to earn an associate degree. #BetterKy

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Now, the election is over and it is time to come together as Americans and as Kentuckians. We are in the fight of our lifetime against COVID-19 and we must unite to battle this virus that has killed 235,000 Americans including more than 1,500 Kentuckians. ^AB

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: One more day closer to beating COVID-19. We will get through this, and we will get through this together. ^AB  https://t.co/xEOokNAdSj

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: On Wednesday, Gov. Andy Beshear encouraged Kentuckians to renew their fight against COVID-19, while celebrating positive budget and economic development news for the commonwealth.  https://t.co/hdqXOPahU2  https://t.co/Jh285xeMiC

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: As of 4 p.m. Friday, Gov. Beshear reported the following COVID-19 numbers:  https://t.co/UOwG8gXtRK  https://t.co/roenXbA0Qh

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Tonight we light our homes green for all of the Kentuckians taken too soon by COVID-19. Like Ruthie Martinez, a beloved wife, mother, grandmother & teacher, who will be greatly missed. We must do what it takes to save lives and protect against the loss of our people. #TogetherKy  https://t.co/V5Cq2YZVlX

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Relieved that for a second time this week my family and I have tested negative today for COVID-19. We will continue our quarantine until cleared by the Department for Public Health. ^AB

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: "COVID-19 is real. It's not over. And what our family is enduring is absolutely terrifying." - Janelle Bardon on her daughter Taylor's experience with this virus.    https://t.co/xHbYC0hSEn

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Governor, family potentially exposed to a person with COVID-19; committed to setting an example by following state, federal quarantine guidelines. Read more:  https://t.co/LvfuEFrWsZ and view a message from Gov. Beshear:  https://t.co/1Tr8JWG8SB

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Waking up to the news the President & First Lady have tested positive for COVID-19. This virus is real and can impact anyone. Wear your mask, social distance and follow the guidelines. To the President, First Lady & everyone facing this virus - we hope for a quick recovery. ^AB

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: While there is no available COVID-19 vaccine at this time, it’s very important to get your flu vaccine this year. Go to  https://t.co/WczixESD2a to find a flu vaccine location near you.  https://t.co/2mhO1zWGsD

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: The moment that we desensitize ourselves to the fact that even a 90-something-year-old has more time with his or her family, grandkids, maybe great-grandkids, and COVID takes it from them – it’s not acceptable. We must fight to protect ALL our people. #TogetherKy  https://t.co/A5KfOrH85R

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: As we continue to battle COVID-19, I applaud @BreedersCup for helping to slow the spread of the virus by making the responsible and right decision to race without fans. We are also very excited that the Breeders' Cup will return to @keeneland in 2022!

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Tonight we must come together across the commonwealth and light our homes green to honor the more than 1,000 Kentuckians lost to COVID-19. These are loved ones taken too soon. We mourn with those in pain, and commit to doing what’s needed to prevent the loss of more. #TogetherKy  https://t.co/CpueBlxWBy

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: With today’s 462 new positive cases of #COVID19, this last week has been our single largest week ever for new cases of COVID: 4,503. It brings our total number of cases to date to 48,032.  https://t.co/oRmeCAojTg   https://t.co/zXJgV8McdI

tweet: Gov. Beshear: Face Coverings Still Crucial to Success in COVID-19 Fight  https://t.co/ygWwHQDJpx  https://t.co/KXtC1g26w3

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: (1 of 2) I just learned the attorney general is asking the Boone Circuit Court judge to void every COVID-19 rule or regulation, and prevent any future orders needed to respond to escalating cases.

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Tune in at 4 pm for our last live #COVID19 update for the week. @LtGovColeman will be joining us to share updates on #HealthyatSchool & we will have information on unemployment. name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: Each day at 10 a.m. we ring our bells and say a word of prayer for those Kentuckians we've lost to COVID-19.   #TogetherKy  https://t.co/PERQ0Daev7

name: Governor Andy Beshear
tweet: At this point, we have seen #COVID19 cases in all but one Kentucky county. Robertson County is the only county that we don’t have a COVID case in. It means the virus has no geographic boundaries and any place can become a hot spot.  https://t.co/ZtBaQUJ7yI
